Package org.ejbca.core.ejb.ra

Interface CertificateRequestSession

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    CertificateRequestSessionLocal, CertificateRequestSessionRemote
    public interface CertificateRequestSession
    Version:
    $Id: CertificateRequestSession.java 25833 2017-05-10 16:19:27Z samuellb $

      Edits or adds a user and generates a certificate for that user in a single transaction.

      Edits or adds a user and generates a certificate for that user in a single transaction.

    • Method Detail

      • processCertReq

        byte[] processCertReq​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                      EndEntityInformation userdata,
                      String req,
                      int reqType,
                      String hardTokenSN,
                      int responseType)
               throws CADoesntExistsException,
                      AuthorizationDeniedException,
                      NotFoundException,
                      InvalidKeyException,
                      NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                      InvalidKeySpecException,
                      NoSuchProviderException,
                      SignatureException,
                      IOException,
                      CertificateException,
                      EndEntityProfileValidationException,
                      ApprovalException,
                      EjbcaException,
                      CesecoreException,
                      CertificateExtensionException
        Edits or adds a user and generates a certificate for that user in a single transaction.
        Parameters:
        admin - is the requesting administrator
        userdata - contains information about the user that is about to get a certificate
        req - is the certificate request, base64 encoded binary request, in the format specified in the reqType parameter
        reqType - is one of SecConst.CERT_REQ_TYPE_..
        hardTokenSN - is the hard token to associate this or null
        responseType - is one of SecConst.CERT_RES_TYPE_...
        Returns:
        a encoded certificate of the type specified in responseType
        Throws:
        CADoesntExistsException - fai;
        AuthorizationDeniedException - fail
        NotFoundException - fail
        InvalidKeyException - fail
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - fail
        InvalidKeySpecException - fail
        NoSuchProviderException - fail
        SignatureException - fail
        IOException - fail
        CertificateException - fail
        EndEntityProfileValidationException - fail
        ApprovalException - fail
        EjbcaException - fail
        CesecoreException - fail
        CertificateExtensionException - if the request contained invalid extensions

      • processCertReq

        ResponseMessage processCertReq​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                               EndEntityInformation userdata,
                               RequestMessage req,
                               Class<? extends CertificateResponseMessage> responseClass)
                        throws EndEntityExistsException,
                               AuthorizationDeniedException,
                               EndEntityProfileValidationException,
                               EjbcaException,
                               CesecoreException,
                               CertificateExtensionException
        Edits or adds a user and generates a certificate for that user in a single transaction. Username and password in userdata and req message must match.
        Parameters:
        admin - is the requesting administrator
        userdata - contains information about the user that is about to get a certificate
        req - is the certificate request
        responseClass - the class of the response message that should be returned back
        Returns:
        a response message of the type specified in responseClass
        Throws:
        EndEntityExistsException - fail
        AuthorizationDeniedException - fail
        EndEntityProfileValidationException - fail
        EjbcaException - fail
        CesecoreException - fail
        CertificateExtensionException - (rollback) if an error exists in the exensions specified in the request

      • processSoftTokenReq

        byte[] processSoftTokenReq​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                           EndEntityInformation userdata,
                           String hardTokenSN,
                           String keyspec,
                           String keyalg,
                           boolean createJKS)
                    throws ApprovalException,
                           EndEntityExistsException,
                           CADoesntExistsException,
                           CertificateSerialNumberException,
                           IllegalNameException,
                           CustomFieldException,
                           AuthorizationDeniedException,
                           EndEntityProfileValidationException,
                           NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                           InvalidKeySpecException,
                           CertificateException,
                           InvalidAlgorithmParameterException,
                           KeyStoreException,
                           NoSuchEndEntityException
        Edits or adds a user and generates a keystore for that user in a single transaction. Used from EjbcaWS.
        Parameters:
        admin - is the requesting administrator
        userdata - contains information about the user that is about to get a keystore
        hardTokenSN - is the hard token to associate this or null
        keyspec - name of ECDSA key or length of RSA and DSA keys
        keyalg - AlgorithmConstants.KEYALGORITHM_RSA, AlgorithmConstants.KEYALGORITHM_DSA or AlgorithmConstants.KEYALGORITHM_ECDSA
        createJKS - true to create a JKS, false to create a PKCS12
        Returns:
        an encoded keystore of the type specified in responseType
        Throws:
        EndEntityProfileValidationException - fail
        AuthorizationDeniedException - fail
        CustomFieldException - fail
        CADoesntExistsException - fail
        EndEntityExistsException - fail
        ApprovalException - fail
        IllegalNameException - if the Subject DN failed constraints
        CertificateSerialNumberException - if SubjectDN serial number already exists.
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - fail
        InvalidKeySpecException - fail
        CertificateException - fail
        InvalidAlgorithmParameterException - fail
        KeyStoreException - fail
        NoSuchEndEntityException - if the end entity was not found
